item.title: Time for a Big Lathe Maintenance!
item.description: A massive lathe gets the maintenance it needs to stay in top shape, with careful checks, adjustments, and repairs to keep it running smoothly for heavy-duty jobs.

media:content.media:description: A massive lathe gets the maintenance it needs to stay in top shape, with careful checks, adjustments, and repairs to keep it running smoothly for heavy-duty jobs.

item.title: Franna Crane Project Diff Removal
item.description: Watch the process of removing the differentials from a Franna crane as part of a major repair project, showcasing the precision and heavy-duty work involved.

item.title: Unexpected Find in Franna Crane Engine Teardown
item.description: During a detailed teardown of a Franna crane engine, surprising issues were uncovered that revealed more about its condition than expected.

item.title: Hydraulic Cylinder Repair: Making a New Barrel | Part 1
item.description: The old barrel was beyond saving, so we fabricated a brand-new one—watch the full hydraulic rebuild process.

item.title: Rebuilding a Universal Head for the Zayer Milling Machine!
item.description: See the step-by-step process of restoring a universal head on a Zayer milling machine, bringing precision and power back to this vital tool.

item.title: Fixing the Rear Frame on a Franna Crane
item.description: Follow the detailed repair of a Franna crane’s rear frame articulation joint, a crucial step to restore its strength and safe operation.

item.title: Building a Heavy-Duty Levelling Spreader Bar
item.description: Step by step through the build of a spreader bar tough enough to handle serious lifting jobs.

item.title: Buying a Trolley? No. Let's Make It
item.description: Instead of buying, we built our own heavy-duty trolley from scratch—stronger, cheaper, and custom fit.

item.title: Giving Our Big Lathe a Much-Needed Upgrade
item.description: Watch as a well-used industrial lathe gets a major refresh, restoring its performance and extending its working life.

item.title: Can This Cracked Final Drive Spindle Be Saved?
item.description: A damaged final drive spindle faces costly replacement, see the detailed process of repair work to determine if it can be restored.

item.title: Mother Of All Cutters: Time to Test It
item.description: Watch as the Mother of All Cutters gets its final machining, assembly, and first spin—bringing this massive custom tool to life.

item.title: CAT D9 Bulldozer Barrel Eye Repair!
item.description: Watch the detailed process of restoring a CAT D9 bulldozer’s barrel eye, bringing heavy equipment back to peak working condition.

item.title: Can This $20k Cylinder Rod Be Saved?
item.description: A damaged cylinder rod faces costly replacement—see the precision work and skill it takes to attempt saving it instead.

item.title: Machining BIG Tractor Wheel Plates | John Deere 9570R
item.description: We are machining centre plates for the wheel rims on a big John Deere 9570R Tractor. The plates don’t fit into the centre of the wheel hub so we are machining to size and machining a radius for weld prep.

item.title: Seized Gland Alert! Can We Save This Cylinder?!
item.description: We're on a mission to rescue this cylinder and save the customer a hefty chunk of coin. This hydraulic cylinder off Caterpillar’s biggest motor grader has a seized gland and the customer has tried everything to break its stubborn grip, but nothing’s budging.

item.title: This Bulldozer Blade Needed a Massive Repair!
item.description: This bulldozer blade off a Caterpillar D8 dozer needs some serious help! The moldboard on the blade is almost completely torn off, the cheek plates and corner plates are damaged, the hungry board is bent and there is no wear protection.

item.title: We Are Making a CUSTOM Trolley!
item.description: We’re fabricating a purpose-built trolley for our metal arc spray machine, it’s time to fire up the welder and bring this custom build to life This shop project’s been on our list for a while, and it’s finally time to tick it off. We’re building a heavy-duty trolley cart for our i450 Metal Arc Spray machine. With laser cut parts, wheels, and some 20mm pipe, we set out to fabricate a heavy-duty custom cart that suits our needs perfectly. We start with tacking the frame together, then move on to fabricating the handle using the radius master for a perfect weld fit. After that, it’s on to sorting out the axle for the wheels. We quickly turned it on the lathe and drilled & tapped for mounting the wheels securely. Once everything’s fully welded out, we grind down the welds, give it a fresh coat of paint, and bolt everything together. The final moment? Putting it to the test with the i450! If you’re into practical fabrication, clean shop builds, and real-world problem solving – this one’s for you.

item.title: Machining a *Huge* Cylinder Rod for Hitachi EX1900!
item.description: We need the BIG Lathe for this machining job! We are making a new cylinder rod for a Hitachi EX1900 Mining Excavator boom lift cylinder. The chrome rod is worn out, it has rust spots and fatigue fractures, so we are going to make a new cylinder rod. This shows the step by step process of removing the eye off the old rod, machining up a new rod and welding the eye onto the rod. First step is machining out the weld joint that holds the eye onto the old rod. Once we remove the eye off the rod we also press out the damaged bushing in our hydraulic press. We then start machining up the new cylinder rod by rough turning before finish machining the end for the piston and nut. We cut a 4mm thread pitch external thread for the nut before flipping the rod to machine the other end. We machine and drill a hole before fitting and stick welding the new rod eye in position. The eye is welded on using metal cored wire before press fitting the new bronze bushing. We finish the job by cleaning, wrapping and strapping the new rod and send it on it’s way to the customer. In this video we are using: Shenyang CW6280B Centre Lathe MetalMaster HPM-150T Hydraulic Press WIA 500i Weldmatic welder

item.title: Cracked Final Drive Spindle Alert
item.description: A critical find during inspection—a cracked final drive spindle that needs urgent repair to prevent major equipment failure.

item.title: Franna Crane Project: Custom Engine Cover
item.description: See how a custom engine cover is designed and built for a Franna crane—combining function, durability, and a perfect fit.
